oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter describing Gen. Nathan B. Forrest's raid on Brentwood, Tenn.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Written from George W. Hamner on April 2, 1863 to a friend Jinnie, he relates "our brigade under General Forrest made a dash on the Yanks the 26th, between Nashville and Franklin, capturing between five and seven hundred, besides their guns, blankets and oil cloths and everything good to eat we found in their camp." He comments that "paper is scarce," having written the letter on stationery captured in the raid.
